attributes.action: Exclude drone 'freestyle/racer' pilots from future drone usage restrictions.
attributes.background: The many 'near miss' drone incidents reported in the media involve drones requiring little skill to fly and piloted by inexperienced individuals. Restrictions would unfairly affect pilots of 'freestyle/racer' drones, which haven't been involved in such an incident to date.
attributes.additional_details:
The following 'drone incident' links all concern 'photography' drones.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39747042
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-39457371
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/nov/17/drone-came-within-5-metres-of-passenger-jet-at-liverpool-airport

Below is some info on drone racing.
http://smashingdrones.com/what-is-drone-racing/
Most racers are >250g, so are affected. Drone racing is highly skilled and its DIY culture would make registering each drone unfeasible.

attributes.action: End entirely the BBC's self-regulating complaints procedure.
attributes.background: The BBC is currently in charge of it own complaints procedure. Only after three phases can a complaint be referred to Ofcom. I have, on multiple occasions, complained about BBC content from television and radio and not once has my complaint been upheld.
attributes.additional_details: I have requested statistical details of how many complaints are given rulings in favour of the complainant and no information has been provided. The BBC should not be able to self-regulate in this way. It is funded by the TV Licence fee and the tax payer and should therefore be accountable to its audience. The BBC should not be self-regulating and all complaints should be made directly to Ofcom. Ofcom should provide a comprehensive response to the complainant and full statistical transparency.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to order Sunderland to create a new Local Plan
attributes.background: The council is proposing a local plan which focuses development on the periphery using only Greenfield and Greenbelt sites. We challenge the assumptions and methodology of the plan. The supporting Greenbelt deletion document had only 14 consultees out of a population of 275000. We demand a new plan.
attributes.additional_details:
We want a new plan to replace the proposal which:
- properly consults about any Greenbelt changes
-considers and prioritises Brownfield sites
-uses accurate population projections and methodologies
-has sustainable transport at its heart
-promotes and protects green spaces as important for communities
-values the individual identities of each community involved

This is an especially urgent case because the council's plan is so flawed. Delay will waste considerable public funds.

attributes.action: Make independent inventory reporting of privately rented properties compulsory
attributes.background:
Independent inventory reporting of privately rented properties on an AST should be a mandatory requirement.

Independent inventories offer protection and help to reduce the number of deposit disputes.

Please support this petition and help us make the letting process more transparent for all.
attributes.additional_details:
As the Private Rented Sector now covers a fifth of all households (EHS 2015-16), it’s crucial that tenants and landlords abide by a fair move-in/move-out process.

Key figures:

- A third of 2,500 tenants admitted having their deposit withheld and 68% believed their landlord didn’t provide good enough reason to do so (Hillarys, 2017).

- 40% of students lose well over a third of their deposit when they rent privately, while 79% do not sign a photo inventory when they move in (Money.co.uk, 2016).

attributes.action: All British goods and produce to be clearly marked with the union flag
attributes.background: Many Patriots would prefer to buy British, it helps British business and many people home and abroad believe British is best but it is often difficult or impossible to identify British goods.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit on the horizon we should be doing all we can to promote British goods.

attributes.action: Immediately boost NHS funding by around £5bn a year from adding 1p to Income Tax
attributes.background: When my own 3-year-old broke his leg, the hospital said he needed a wheelchair but they could no longer afford them. Our 8-year-old son had to join a two year waiting list for an autism assessment. For the sake of all children in the UK, the NHS urgently needs more funding.
attributes.additional_details: It’s a policy that has previously been put forward by the Liberal Democrats, and was backed by a group of senior health professionals at the time including Sir David Nicholson, who led NHS England for almost a decade, and the previous heads of the Royal College of General Practitioners and also the Royal College of Psychiatrists.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the annual Yulin Dog Eating Festival
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 
Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison between the eating of beef or lamb and dog-meat.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 11 million people worldwide signed a petition against dog slaughter at Yulin. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/yulin-dog-meat-festival-ban-petition-11-million-sign-slaughters-thousands-animals-china-a7081521.html
Despite this the festival went ahead in 2017. 
Unlike cattle, dogs/cats have a greater understanding of suffering:
https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/animal/article/identifying-and-monitoring-pain-in-farm-animals-a-review/CECEC60BB101FF770ED7E594E0CCE8BA

attributes.action: Change immigration Rules and accept full time study in UK as proof of English
attributes.background: My son is 18 years old and has 7 years of full time study in UK. He is first year at University now and has ABBBB in Higher Mathematics,English,Physics,Chemistry and Biology.His application for British Citizenship has being refused because had No prove of Speaking and Understanding English Language.
attributes.additional_details: Please help our immigrant children, who have being taught in English and have learned the British values, not to be humiliated and accept their years of study in this country as proof of English. After seven years of study in the United Kingdom it is unacceptable to be asked to give one more test to prove they can speak and understand the English language. Please sign this petition to change this abusive rule and help our children. Thank you for taking your time to read my petition.

attributes.action: Return Tax raising powers in Scotland to the UK Government
attributes.background: The Scottish Government is planning a new rise in income tax. It already imposes a different threshold for taxation at the higher rate to the rest of the UK. Tax raising powers should be returned to the UK Government to make taxation in Scotland equal.

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable stay in their home.
attributes.background: The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable and people on limited budgets. With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with.
attributes.additional_details: With the cost of food on the increase, it is getting harder for vulnerable people with the bedroom tax another expense on top of their limited budget.

attributes.action: Bring home the last dambusters Lancaster bomber.
attributes.background: We would like the British government to bring the wreckage of "Easy Elsie" the last lancaster bomber from 617 squadron - (the dambusters) back to the UK. She crash landed in in a swamp in Porjus, Sweden on 29-10-1944 after attempting to sink the Tirpitz. All of Elsie's crew survived.
attributes.additional_details: She currently lies outside, open to the elements, while slowly rotting and being scavenged by souvenir hunters. We believe this historic and unique piece of British military heritage should be returned home, preserved and used to educate this and future generations about the bravery and sacrifice made by our ancestors during world war 2.

attributes.action: Fund Slow Down For Horses and Horse Awareness Adverts on Television
attributes.background: We see adverts warning drivers of the dangers of speeding. A horse is a live animal, unpredictable in most surroundings and traffic. We need adverts to highlight this with stories and evidence to hit home. Horse riding has become more popular which is resulting in more accidents and even deaths.

attributes.action: Make Changing Places mandatory in the large public places listed in BS 8300:2009
attributes.background: Changing Places provide all the equipment that severely disabled people need, such as ceiling hoist, adult sized changing bed, centrally placed toilet, and adequate space. Changing Places are RECOMMENDED in BS 8300:2009, but should be mandatory so disabled people can be equal members of society.
attributes.additional_details: BS 8300:2009 RECOMMENDS that Changing Places should be built in large public places such as Shopping Centres, airports, leisure centres, sports stadiums, town halls, and auditoria, to name but a few. Disabled people often have to be changed on dirty toilet floors which is degrading, unhygienic and dangerous. Many disabled people choose to stay at home because the facilities they need do not exist in their community. Changing Places should be mandatory as they are a necessity for severely disabled people.

attributes.action: Allow Students Who Are Estranged From Family To Claim Housing Benefit In Summer
attributes.background: Students are not permitted to access Housing Benefit. But 'estranged students', whose relationship with their parents has broken down, and who are not leaving care, are not given any financial maintenance for the 10-week summer break. Thousands of students face homelessness over summer as a result.
attributes.additional_details: Student maintenance loans are calculated to cover the costs of studying during term time, assuming a level of family support over the holidays. In England And Wales, there are around 9,000 estranged students, who don’t have parental support and who aren’t care leavers. Research shows these students struggle with homelessness over the summer break. The government should lift restrictions, allowing students without parental or local authority support to receive housing benefit over summer.

attributes.action: Halt the cuts to the Metropolitan Police budget
attributes.background:
Having lost £600 million in real terms over the past 7 years, the Metropolitan Police face a further £400 million cut over the next 4 years.

70 per cent of all police spending in London comes from the Home Office, meaning that any change in that funding has a disproportionate effect.

attributes.action: Require the late dialysis service at Manchester Royal Infirmary to continue
attributes.background:
Keep The Late Renal Dialysis Service at Manchester Royal Infirmary to 22:30pm.
I and my fellow Renal Dialysis patients would like to continue having access to the late shift to 22:30pm.
attributes.additional_details:
The Renal Dialysis late shift (up to 22:30pm) is vital for people like me & fellow patients who work in the daytime ( I work in a high school in a very important role). 
The late shift is key to mine and my fellow patient's rotas and timetables as we have already done so much work in the background to accommodate the Renal 
Dialysis treatment that happens every week in our lives. 

We also need to live normal lives as much as anyone. We shouldn’t save money over care.

attributes.action: Make Postural Awareness with Pilates and Yoga part of the Secondary Curriculum.
attributes.background: The digital age has a huge impact on teenage posture, cognitive processes, emotional stability and physical health.  This results in an increase of immune, digestive and respiratory deficiencies, behavioural problems and Mental Health.
attributes.additional_details:
We are proposing a multidisciplinary holistic program which brings together the most valuable benefits of Pilates, Yoga, natural movement and mindfulness.  Our Programme aims to support teenagers in developing their anatomical strength changing their cognitive processes from negative to positive improving their emotional stability, behaviour and overall health.

‘Much effort is put into educating children’s minds but teaching them how to use their bodies is often ignored. This is an opportunity to give teenagers lifelong skills on how to look after their bodies’ - David Meyer, Head Teacher.

attributes.action: Revise current Care Order categories for adoption breakdowns.
attributes.background: Often adoption disruptions take place due to factors outside of the adopter’s control, such as previous trauma that the child has experienced and the lack of support that is available to adopters. Adoption disruptions rarely take place due to a lack of love or because the adopter is abusive.
attributes.additional_details:
In order for the local authority to gain parental responsibility of a child (whether from adopters or birth parents) they must evidence that the child is/ or likely to suffer significant harm due to either emotional, sexual, physical, neglect or mental abuse. 

If an adoption disrupts due to no fault of the parents or child, this does not fall into any of the above categories of abuse yet the social worker must still pick one. Therefore the current system is unfit for purpose.

attributes.action: Change the law so that all dogs have to be on a lead in public areas
attributes.background:
On April 22nd 2016 my grandson Anton was horrifically attacked by a neighbours pet dog, the dog was not on a lead as the owner set out to walk it. It grabbed my grandson causing severe injuries. 
I see way too often dog owners walking with their dogs in public areas without the dog being on a lead.
attributes.additional_details: How many more children are going to be scared for life or even killed before we act? If dog owners cannot take responsibility for owning a dog then the people who are elected to keep us safe must act for our us and our children. All dogs in any public areas should be on a lead. Dog owners of which I am one need to be more responsible and understand dogs can and do kill. If you are out with your dog be understanding there maybe other children like Anton scared of your dog.

attributes.action: Amend the law to deal with repeated dog on dog attacks.
attributes.background: Under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, action can only be taken against a dog owner if their dog attacks a person or an assistance dog. I want to see this extended so that where a dog severely attacks other dogs (where they require vet treatment) that action can be taken by the police against the owner
attributes.additional_details: As a dog owner, whose dog has been attacked and put in the vets, I am horrified to hear and read about this same dog attacking other dogs. When these attacks are then reported to the police, owners are informed nothing can be done, as in is not detailed in the "dangerous dogs act". I feel strongly that this needs to change. I am not asking for dogs to be put down, but that they have to wear a muzzle in public. For me, this is part of being a responsible dog owner.

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide deposit return system for plastic bottles in the UK
attributes.background: We call for the UK-wide introduction of a deposit return scheme for drinks bottles and cans. While Scotland is planning such a scheme, the rest of the country must not fall behind. Given the near-ubiquitous plastic pollution of oceans and land environments, urgent action is required by the whole UK.
attributes.additional_details: Worldwide, 8 million tonnes of plastic leaks into the oceans annually, where it fragments into ever-smaller particles. According to scientific studies, it can now be found in the guts of 90% of seabirds, in 1/3 of UK-caught fish, and even in tap water. Urgent action is needed. Of the 35 million plastic bottles discarded daily by British households, almost half do not get recycled. Many countries already have deposit return schemes. In the German one, over 97% of PET plastic bottles get recycled.

attributes.action: Provide all student nurses and midwives with additional maintenance loan
attributes.background: At the moment, healthcare students are given the same maintenance loans that all undergraduates apply for - this basic rate is made on the average course length of 30 weeks 3 days and ignores the requirements of our course length.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently a first year student studying in Manchester. Like many others, we are currently expected to make our third loan instalment last from April till September which includes essential fees such as uniform, travel expenses and living costs. Working a minimum of 22.5 weekly unpaid placement hours, attending university and studying leaves us little opportunity to take up a part-time job and therefore fund ourselves.

attributes.action: Require gas products to only be sold to qualified Gas Engineers.
attributes.background: This is important as it would make it nigh on impossible for illegal installers to put the general public in danger, by installing equipment incorrectly. It would allow all installations to be traceable and if a poor/unsafe installation was found it would mean the HSE could actually ACT.
attributes.additional_details: There are around 40 deaths and 200 hospitalisations every year attributed to accidental CO poisoning. The department for health indicate that there are 4,000 attendances at accident and emergency departments for CO poisoning each year in England. This logical step would make all those cases possibly lead to prosecution.

attributes.action: Change the GCSE English Literature exam from closed book to open book.
attributes.background: Last year, lots of students struggled with GCSE English Literature as it was a closed book exam. Because of this many failed. How can they expect us to remember quotes from 15 poems, plus how to analyse them, plus remembering the whole plot, themes, characters and quotes from another book.
attributes.additional_details: Is it really fair that students have to remember so much, whilst also doing revision for other exams. It is important to know how to do all that is asked in the exams, but when in life will you ever have to remember lots of information about lots of texts, then be expected to recall it perfectly under pressured conditions, on top of loads of other stresses, then write about it for strangers to judge whether or not you are worthy of a good grade or not.

attributes.action: cut costs for NHS staff to park on site at work and provide permits to all staff
attributes.background: Currently there is an extremely long waiting list for a permit (>4 years). Staff are forced to park off site and walk alone in dark areas to their cars which is very unsafe and due to excessive amounts of staff having to park off site means having to arrive 45 mins prior to shift starting.
attributes.additional_details: £20 a day on site parking would be the only other option which is not affordable.

attributes.action: Secure the free movement of UK citizens currently resident in EU member states
attributes.background:
The current deal between the EU and UK regarding Brexit states UK citizens will be able to carry on enjoying the same rights as of now in the country we live in. It doesn’t not state we will continue to enjoy free movement within the union. 
Many british Expats in the EU depend on this for work.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people work over borders within the EU.
Many have family in other EU countries.
We have integrated ourselves into the union through free movement.

attributes.action: End benefit sanctions, punishments to make the poor more poor.
attributes.background:
The welfare state was invented to support those in need, to support those in need. It should never be used as a form of finacial blackmail. Sanctions make people need more, they make poor people more poor and they victimise the most vulnerable in our society. 

it is time we put an end to this.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence to support this is in the fact that use of food banks has risen so dramatically. That homelessness has more than doubled. 

There is also the fact that I have endured sanctions myself, where I went weeks without money and had to use food banks myself. 

The evidence is everywhere, and has been in the news, there have been studies after studies that have said that sanctions and universal credit are causing more poverty. 

It is time to stop using abject poverty as a punishment.

attributes.action: Provide adequate parking facilities for HGV Drivers
attributes.background: With the DVSA imposing new regulations from 4/11/17 regarding where HGV drivers can legally take their weekly rest breaks we are petitioning for adequate facilities to be made available to HGV drivers
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to raise awareness of the issues faced by HGV drivers across the uk with the lack of adequate rest areas available to them at a reasonable/no cost. With the DVSA imposing more regulations on drivers from 4/11/17 preventing HGV drivers stopping for their 45 hour legal weekly rest break in lay-bys, we demand that the government/department of transport start providing adequate,safe,hygienic and reasonably priced rest areas with a good standard of food and facilities.

attributes.action: Improve allergen labelling on food packaging.
attributes.background:
8% of children and 2% of adults have one or more potentially life threatening food allergies (not intolerances), yet labelling is unclear.
Food should be labelled with:
the front of packaging should have icons to show the type of allergen*. 
The back should list all allergens separately.
attributes.additional_details:
May contains statements are currently optional - leaving people unsure if food is safe. They should be mandatory where there is a genuine risk of cross contamination. Even a small amount of allergen can be fatal.

Currently allergens are made bold in the main ingredients list. Allergy sufferers and their carers have to carefully examine the ingredients to spot them.

Sources:
https://www.anaphylaxis.org.uk/

*Icons for allergens:
http://www.erudus.com/standardised-food-allergy-icons/

attributes.action: Secure the release of Jack Letts who is detained in northern Syria
attributes.background: Our son, Jack Letts, has been 'disappeared' in a Guantanamo-style ‘black site’ in Kurdish territory in Syria and has had no contact with the outside world since July 8. The British government is refusing to engage with the Kurdish authorities to secure his release. We greatly fear for his life.
attributes.additional_details: The British police told us there is no evidence Jack was involved in violence in Syria. However, the government believes it has public opinion on its side in keeping Jack without charge in foreign detention. The press has condemned him as a jihadi, despite evidence showing he courageously stood against Isis. His detention conditions are appalling, including no exercise and months in solitary confinement. If there are charges against him, he should be allowed to defend himself in a British court.

attributes.action: I call on the government to change the legislation on assisted dying
attributes.background: I've been living with Motor Neuron Disease (MND) for 12 years, I'm unable to use my arms and hands, and have muscle wastage round my neck, I can't wash, dress or feed myself, however, there is a possibility that one day I could be paralysed from the neck down, unable to talk or Swallow.
attributes.additional_details: whilst I'm happy getting on with my life. If the time come when I was paralysed from the neck down, unable too talk or swallow, then I wouldn't want to continue  living, and I think it's my right as an individual to have the opportunity to die with dignity helped by a doctor, it shouldn't be impossible for politicians to create legislation that gives me that right, but also protects the weak and vulnerable in society

attributes.action: Extend to UK citizens the family rights guaranteed for EU citizens in the UK.
attributes.background: In the Brexit negotiations, family rights for EU citizens were guaranteed including the right for non EEA family members to join them in the UK. This should be extended to include UK citizens who must meet income thresholds, huge visa fees + complex rules before non EEA family members can live here
attributes.additional_details:
We support the family rights of Europeans in the UK.
But currently UK citizens must earn £18600 to bring a non EEA spouse or partner to the UK. This rises by £3800 to bring a child here + £2600 for each subsequent child.
UK citizens must pay thousands of pounds of visa fees and the Immigration Health Surcharge for our non EEA family members.
If we make any mistakes on our visa forms our family members must leave the UK and appeal from overseas. 
We demand parity with European citizens in the UK.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16
attributes.background: The voting age should be lowered to 16 because I think that people are responsible enough to know what they are voting for and they are deciding their future. 16 year olds are eligible to enlist in the army but are not allowed to vote for who makes the decisions that change their future.

attributes.action: A new Railway station for Droylsden East
attributes.background: Droylsden East has an extremely busy road between Littlemoss and Droylsden town centre. This road leads to Ashton under lyne and Manchester city centre the other way. With a new school planned for Littlemoss this road will become worse.
attributes.additional_details: The fact this road is also occupied by heavy goods vehicles from Hadfield transport has made this even worse. A Railway station was closed due to the Beeching cuts but the fact the area around Littlemoss has almost doubled justifies the new station. This will help people get to other areas of the country easily and ease congestion on this busy stretch of road.

attributes.action: Put a drug education system in schools
attributes.background: Drug taking is becoming the 'in' thing and people are becoming more curious about drugs at younger ages, to help save lives, a drug education system should be put into schools.

attributes.action: Give parents the right to make an audio recording with social workers
attributes.background: I wanted an audio recording of a meeting with social services as I have a disability which makes it difficult to take notes and affects my memory. I also felt under stress and worried that things I have said or others have said might not be recorded accurately. I wasn’t allowed to record it.
attributes.additional_details: I informed them in writing I would record the whole meeting & it would not be edited. I would send an unedited copy of the recording to the other people at the meeting. Also the recording was for my own use, for any court proceedings or taking legal advice. I would not distribute it on the internet. This is allowed under the Data Protection 1997 Act, Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000 & the Human Rights Act Article 10. There is no law saying I need their permission. I am not a data controller so I am not bound by the act.

attributes.action: Help fund the cost of redistributing more edible surplus food to charity.
attributes.background: It can cost up to £150 per tonne to separate, store and transport edible surplus food to charity. If this cost were reimbursed far more of the 270,000 tonnes of edible surplus in the system would go to people who need it. For only £10-15m per year, 100,000 tonnes of food could be donated to charity.
attributes.additional_details:
This funding could save UK charities millions. If only 100,000 tonnes of surplus was redistributed it could save them between £150-200m - at least a tenfold return. 
At current levels of redistribution it would only cost £2.6m per year.
If we are wrong and this doesn't increase, the cost doesn't go up. If we are right, every pound will result in exponential benefit to charity.
This is great value, potentially hugely effective and risk free.
To read more go to thegrocer.co.uk/wastenotwantnot

attributes.action: Make photo ID mandatory in all elections and Referenda.
attributes.background: We believe production of photo ID in all future elections and Referenda should be mandatory. There have been several examples of personation in elections. Bringing in mandatory photo ID when voting would remove this problem.

attributes.action: Extend VAT exemption for elderly/disabled peoples' domestic help in their homes
attributes.background:
Since 2007 we have run a business supporting elderly/disabled people with domestic help,enabling them to remain safely and independently in their own homes.
Domestic Care companies should be able to offer a reputable service on a VAT exempt basis to make it more affordable to self funding clients.
attributes.additional_details:
We wrote to our local MP, his reply states he agrees with the proposal.
The CQC web site details that only companies offering personal care can be regulated.VAT Notice 701/2 on HMRC web site confirms regulated group limitations.
Most personal care companies don't want to do domestic care  and vice versa.The two services are very different but,both essential to the elderly/disabled.
Elderly people should not have to be taxed on a service which enables them to remain independently in their homes

attributes.action: Force the legal separation of ticketing companies from ticket resale companies.
attributes.background:
The ticketing companies have no interest in selling all tickets at original face value as they will inflate their profits by selling them through their related businesses.
"Sold out" tickets appear on resale sites within minutes of release for several times the face value.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing ticketing companies to own related companies which can resell tickets at a higher price has an inherent conflict.

attributes.action: To retract the £1bn DUP deal and use the money across the whole United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Conservative Party promised £1bn to Northern Ireland as part of a deal to secure a majority government with the Democratic Unionist Party. This deal should be suspended and the £1bn should be spent  across the whole of the UK, not to prop up a Parliamentary majority.

attributes.action: End the benefits freeze
attributes.background: The freeze of working age benefits will take almost £1 billion from the pockets of people living in Scotland by 2020/21. People across Scotland are affected by the freeze and by ending it we will improve both our society and the economy by putting money in people’s pockets.
attributes.additional_details:
Keeping the cash value of benefits the same while costs are rising is pushing people into poverty. The freeze on working age benefits will affect around 750,000 households by the end of the decade.
Reversing the freeze could help lift people out of poverty and prevent others from falling into poverty. Research from CPAG shows that reversing the freeze to even just the child element of tax credits and child benefit could keep up to 400,000 children across the UK from falling into poverty.

attributes.action: include The Baha'i Faith as part of the Religious Studies Syllabus in Schools.
attributes.background:
The Baha'i Faith is the world's youngest religion. It is only 173 years old.

It brings all other major religions together and is based on Unity of Mankind.

It makes sense! and can potentially save a lot of conflicts in the world.
attributes.additional_details:
www.bahai.org

There are over 6 million Baha'is in the world and the interesting concept is that they come from all sorts of backgrounds.

attributes.action: Allow the collection of store points when purchasing stage one infant formula.
attributes.background:
You are unable to earn Boots Advantage Card points, Tesco Clubcard or Nectar points when buying stage one baby milk, as it is perceived to discourage breastfeeding. 
I believe this law should be changed so that families who can't or chose not to breastfeed their children are not being penalised.
attributes.additional_details: The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula Regulation 2007 prohibits the promotion of formula feeding & this includes allowing families to earn points for buying stage one formula, points can also not be used to buy formula. Points are available when purchasing items relating to breastfeeding (breast pumps/ pads etc). Therefore I believe it to be discriminatory against those who can't or don't want to breastfeed their children that points cannot be collected against stage one formula.

attributes.action: Outlaw the excessive noise levels that are associated with fireworks.
attributes.background: The explosions that are part of many firework displays are uncomfortably loud to humans and are very often terrifying to animals who suffer as a result.The bangs are not a necessary part of the display and the spectacle would not suffer if loud bangs were not part of it.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.
attributes.additional_details: Please visit: http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Drastically improve funding for mental health services
attributes.background: I have personally experienced the impact of the cuts to mental health services when I needed the help the most and I know I am not the only one who has experienced this: child or adult. There needs to be far more funding and support from the Government, but more importantly the Minister of Health.
attributes.additional_details: One in four people will experience or may have already experienced mental health problems. The Government really need to start helping those in need and support those that are in need of help. Increased funding to mental health services will drastically reduce the waiting time children, adolescents and adults have to wait to begin counselling and therapy.

attributes.action: Amend driving licences to remove the unnecessary title from women's licences.
attributes.background: UK driving licences betray a clear and unwarranted gender bias. Men's driving licences are in their name without a title: John Smith. Women's driving licences contain a title: Miss Joan Smith. There is no reason for this. Someone's marital or academic status has no impact on their ability to drive.

attributes.action: Paediatric mental health training within the NHS medical staff
attributes.background: The issue is that the paediatric medical staff (NHS) doesn't know how to deal with mental health at all when a child is admitted to the ward for observation, with mental health training the staff  would be able to provide a better duty of care. (See additional details for a personal story)
attributes.additional_details:
Backround:
The reason for this petition is that my child has multiple mental illnesses and has been hospitalised as a result of this 5 times in 2017, when at the emergency department a lot of the staff was unsure what to do, they just sent the child up to the paediatric ward to be in overnight until CAMHS would arrive. However in all instances the staff was unsure what to do.

attributes.action: Reduce The Minimum Income Requirement for Spouse Visa
attributes.background: Government should reduce the minimum income requirement for British spouse visa, from £18,600 to £14,400. In many jobs, a person can save a lot from their monthly income and can provide for two people (themselves and the spouse) without relying on public funds. The incomes are lower outside London.
attributes.additional_details: Many British citizens working in the UK on slightly lower pay, especially outside London. They’re employed and the income they earn are enough to provide for themselves and the spouse. The government should consider this. In Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland, the income rates are lower than England.
